title: Error that says the server is reset and it won't connect.
content: all of a sudden Thunderbird is just giving a message that says the server is reset and it won't connect. Nothing has been changed. This situation just started. I have made no changes.
creator: gayinmysoul

title: email addresses
content: When I transferred Thunderbird from my old computer to my new computer, my messages transferred but my email addresses did not. What do I need to do to transfer my email addresses.
creator: wittydavid4

title: Emails not showing up in folders
content: In the process of migrating away from Outlook to Thunderbird. Installed Thunderbird and connected to gmail using IMAP easy enough. Used ReliefJet Essentials to convert a PST file to MBOX. That process appeared to go well. Folders were created during the process and folder structures corresponded to the folder structures in the original PST. Each folder also contained corresponding *.mbox files. .mbox file contents looked appropriate when opening with notepad. Problem begins here. My intention was to access the those messages under "Local Folders." Under local folders account settings, I pointed Message Storage 'local directly' to the folder where the directories and .mbox files are stored. After a restart, Thunderbird sees the folders BUT NOT the individuals messages in the folders. What have a done wrong...?
creator: lee.pinson

title: forwarding incoming mail to a gmail address
content: I need to forward a copy of my incoming mail to a gmail account. How do I set that up?
creator: wcclarke

title: When Tbird calendar opens, the reminder is blank.
content: When a reminder comes up on mine. There is a blank spot where I would think it would give what the reminder was.. So this box comes up with the reminder, the heading is there but underneath where i would think exactly what the reminder was about, is a blank area. Is there a setting I'm missing somewhere or something? thanks I can't do a screen shot that would help if the reminder hasn't come up
creator: Chilkoot

title: Thread removal Thunderbird Local folder and sub folders
content: I NEVER use threads but somehow recent folders I create in my local folder for archiving off the imap cloud now automatically are threaded even though in my selected columns to display the thread option is not activated. It seems that a recent updated added this function to new folders I create. How do I turn it off? Thank you.
creator: eastcott
